noun.description: The state of being stretched tight.
examples: the parachute keeps the cable under tension as it drops
a mind that is affected by stress or tension cannot think as clearly

verb.description: Apply a force to (something) which tends to stretch it.

origin: Mid 16th century (as a medical term denoting a condition or feeling of being physically stretched or strained): from French, or from Latin tensio(n-), from tendere stretch.
